meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>wash</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to wash</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You have <vocabulary>to wash</vocabulary> <reading>a ro</reading>ck (あら) you found. It looks shiny, but you can't tell until you wash it.
